dc_title_s: Anglia Regnum; Amstelodami, Apud Ioannem Ianssonium.; Anglia Regnvm
dc_description_s: Relief shown pictorially. Ireland and Scotland are mostly blank, but labeled with some coastal cities, rivers, and their respective coats of arms (a harp for Ireland, a lion for Scotland). Title cartouche has two lamb heads and berries, and is topped with the Royal Arms of England (three lions). A crowned lion and a catlike dragon are next to it. Vignette in upper right shows lion with a crown and unicorn posing on either side of a coat of arms. Drawings of ships are on the ocean. Next to the scale in the lower right corner is a cherub and two lambs. This state was published in atlases by Jan Jansson in 1636, 1637, and 1680. From the Jansson Appendix Atlas 1636-1680, title created to represent a unique collection within the Clark Library, University of Michigan. 1 map; 38 x 48 cm. This map is in the public domain. Please attribute access and use of this digitized map to the Stephen S. Clark Library, University of Michigan Library.
dc_creator_sm: Jansson, Jan, 1588-1664.,Jansson, Jan, 1588-1664. Appendix Atlas.,Vignaud, Henry, 1830-1922, former owner.
